TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ServerChannelSinkStack extends System.Object implements class System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IServerChannelSinkStack, class System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IServerResponseChannelSinkStack

Docs.summary: Holds the stack of server channel sinks.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class makes a link demand. A security exception is thrown if the immediate caller does not have infrastructure permission. See [Link Demands](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) for more information.

Docs.permission: for operating with infrastructure code. Demand value: ; Permission value:

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AsyncProcessResponse (System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMessage msg, System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.ITransportHeaders headers, System.IO.Stream stream);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AsyncProcessResponse(class System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMessage msg, class System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.ITransportHeaders headers, class System.IO.Stream stream) cil managed

Docs.param: The message to be serialized onto the requested stream.
The headers retrieved from the server response stream.
The stream coming back from the transport sink.
Docs.summary: Requests asynchronous processing of a method call on the sinks in the current sink stack.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method initializes asynchronous processing on the top sink in the current sink stack. For additional information, see the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IServerChannelSink.AsyncProcessResponse%2A> method.

Docs.exception: The current sink stack is empty.
Docs.permission: for operating with infrastructure code. Demand value: ; Permission value:

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.IO.Stream GetResponseStream(class System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMessage msg, class System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.ITransportHeaders headers) cil managed

Docs.param: The message to be serialized onto the requested stream.
The headers retrieved from the server response stream.
Docs.summary: Returns the <xref:System.IO.Stream> onto which the specified message is to be serialized.
Docs.returns: The <xref:System.IO.Stream> onto which the specified message is to be serialized.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method returns the stream returned by the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IServerChannelSink.GetResponseStream%2A?displayProperty=fullName> called with the `msg` and `headers` parameters (<xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IServerChannelSink.GetResponseStream%2A> (`msg`, `headers`)) on the top sink in the current sink stack. The top sink in the sink stack remains unchanged.

Docs.permission: for operating with infrastructure code. Demand value: ; Permission value:

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Pop(class System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IServerChannelSink sink) cil managed

Docs.param: The sink to remove and return from the sink stack.
Docs.summary: Pops the information associated with all the sinks from the sink stack up to and including the specified sink.
Docs.returns: Information generated on the request side and associated with the specified sink.
Docs.exception: The current sink stack is empty, or the specified sink was never pushed onto the current stack.
Docs.permission: for operating with infrastructure code. Demand value: ; Permission value:

MemberSignature.Value: public void Push (System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IServerChannelSink sink, object state);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Push(class System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IServerChannelSink sink, object state) cil managed

Docs.param: The sink to push onto the sink stack.
Information generated on the request side that is needed on the response side.
Docs.summary: Pushes the specified sink and information associated with it onto the sink stack.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The information generated on the request side and specified in the `state` parameter is returned in the `state` parameter of the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IServerChannelSink.AsyncProcessResponse%2A> method on the corresponding sink.

Docs.permission: for operating with infrastructure code. Demand value: ; Permission value:

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ServerCallback(class System.IAsyncResult ar) cil managed

Docs.param: The status and state of an asynchronous operation on a remote object.
Docs.summary: Provides a <xref:System.AsyncCallback> delegate to handle a callback after a message has been dispatched asynchronously.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The dispatched message represents a request method call on a remote object.
The ServerCallback method is intended for use only by the .NET Framework remoting infrastructure. You should not call it directly.

Docs.permission: for operating with infrastructure code. Demand value: ; Permission value:

MemberSignature.Value: public void Store (System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IServerChannelSink sink, object state);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Store(class System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IServerChannelSink sink, object state) cil managed

Docs.summary: Stores a message sink and its associated state for later asynchronous processing.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Store method is intended for use only by the .NET Framework remoting infrastructure. You should not call it directly.

Docs.exception:
The current sink stack is empty.
-or-
The specified sink was never pushed onto the current stack.
Docs.permission: for operating with infrastructure code. Demand value: ; Permission value:

MemberSignature.Value: public void StoreAndDispatch (System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IServerChannelSink sink, object state);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void StoreAndDispatch(class System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IServerChannelSink sink, object state) cil managed

Docs.summary: Stores a message sink and its associated state, and then dispatches a message asynchronously, using the sink just stored and any other stored sinks.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The StoreAndDispatch method is intended for use only by the .NET Framework remoting infrastructure. You should not call it directly.
The method should be only called by a transport sink to complete an asynchronous dispatch.

Docs.permission: for operating with infrastructure code. Demand value: ; Permission value:
